matching-players:
Cards are laid out face down in a grid. Each card has exactly one matching pair somewhere in the grid.

    Flip over two cards:
  • If they match, they will be removed.
  • If they don’t match, they will be faced down again

    • Win by matching all pairs as quickly and with as few moves as possible.
quarto:
Your goal is to create a line (horizontal, vertical, or diagonal) of four pieces that share a common attribute.

Each piece has 4 attributes, each attribute having 2 options - big or small, light or dark, square or round, solid or hollow.

You don’t pick your own piece to place — your opponent chooses it for you! You place that piece anywhere on the board. Then you pick a piece for your opponent to place next.
quarto2x2:
In this Quarto variant, You can win by placing four matching pieces that share the same attribute in a 2x2 square.

    Like in standard Quarto:
  • Each piece has 4 attributes, each attribute having 2 options - tall or short, light or dark, square or round, solid or hollow.
  • You don’t pick your own piece to place — your opponent chooses it for you! You place that piece anywhere on the board. Then you pick a piece for your opponent to place next.
tertio:
Its rules are similar to Quarto, but it is played with 8 pieces.

Your goal is to create a line (horizontal, vertical, or diagonal) of three pieces that share a common attribute.

Each piece has 3 attributes, each attribute having 2 options - light or dark, square or round, solid or hollow.

You don’t pick your own piece to place — your opponent chooses it for you! You place that piece anywhere on the board. Then you pick a piece for your opponent to place next.

connect-4:
Connect 4 is a classic two-player strategy game where the goal is to be the first to get four of your own colored discs in a row — either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.

    Gameplay:
  • Players take turns dropping one disc at a time into any of the 7 columns.
  • A disc always falls to the lowest available space in the column.
  • You can’t place a disc in a full column.
connect-3:
Connect 3 is a classic two-player strategy game where the goal is to be the first to get three of your own colored discs in a row — either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.

    Gameplay:
  • Players take turns dropping one disc at a time into any of the 4 columns.
  • A disc always falls to the lowest available space in the column.
  • You can’t place a disc in a full column.
